"Learn how to make perfect scrambled eggs with this easy recipe. A quick breakfast packed with protein."
"2 large free range eggs\n6 tablespoon single cream or full cream milk\na knob of butter"

"STEP 1
Lightly whisk 2 large eggs, 6 tablespoon single cream or full cream milk and a pinch of salt together until the mixture has just one consistency.

STEP 2
Heat a small non-stick frying pan for a minute or so, then add a knob of butter and let it melt. Don’t allow the butter to brown or it will discolour the eggs.

STEP 3
Pour in the egg mixture and let it sit, without stirring, for 20 seconds. Stir with a wooden spoon, lifting and folding it over from the bottom of the pan.

STEP 4
Let it sit for another 10 seconds then stir and fold again.

STEP 5
Repeat until the eggs are softly set and slightly runny in places. Remove from the heat and leave for a moment to finish cooking.

STEP 6
Give a final stir and serve the velvety scramble without delay.

"I invite you for my best recipe for croquettes with mushrooms and cheese. You can prepare them for dinner. They will be perfect with borscht."

"1 cup flour
2 eggs
1.5 cups milk
1 teaspoon salt
500 grams mushrooms
1 tablespoon frying oil"

"Step 1
Combine the flour with the milk, eggs and a pinch of salt to form a classic pancake batter.

Step 2
Fry thin pancakes in a Teflon pan with a little oil.

Step 3
Grate the mushrooms on a coarse grater and fry in a pan with oil.

Step 4
Add a pinch of salt to the mushrooms and fry until all the water evaporates and the mushrooms become very dark.

Step 5
Add Knorr seasoning at the end of frying and fry until the mushrooms become quite thick. Serve immediately or fry them additionally sauteed or with breadcrumbs. They taste great with a spoonful of sour cream."
